page.title: 16THEN AND NOW
page.content: Over my 90 years in the village I've seen many changes.Fire and floods have destroyed many buildings,new estates have taken their place.Life in the village is quite different now.Cars have taken the place of the horse needing speed signs at every street.We do have electric lighting,piped water and main sewerage; a great change for the better,but my thoughts go back to the days when sheep bells tinkled on the Downs,carter boys sang to their horses as they plodded to and fro in the fields.We have lost a few shops,builders and blacksmiths but it is still a beautiful place to live in.
